content.main_text: Understand how to accommodate dietary preferences and restrictions through food substitutions.
content.section_1_content: Food substitutions, also called accommodations, involve modifying dishes to meet dietary needs or preferences.
content.section_2_content: Examples include replacing ingredients to make dishes vegan, gluten-free, dairy-free, nut-free, soy-free, or sesame-free.
content.section_3_content: Identifying available accommodations helps ensure meals are inclusive and safe for everyone.

questions.question_text: Which of the following accommodations can be made for {dish_name}?
questions.hint: Review the modifications available for this dish. 'Accommodations' refer to the substitutions that can be made to meet dietary restrictions or preferences.
